results.title: Television violence and children
results.brief_description: Does television violence have an effect on children? This is one of many questions asked of a panel of experts on a subject of concern to parents and teachers. Includes interviews with Dr T Radecky, Chairman of the USA based National Coalition Against Violence. No other credits available.

results.title: Grim reaper. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: In part 1, entitled “The True story” Professor John Dwyer of the University of New South Wales discusses the causes and effects of AIDS with a group of Year 10 to Year 12 students. In Part 2, “Education’s responsibilities” Professor Dwyer leads a discussion with a principal, teachers, health worker and school counsellor on the problems that may arise in schools because of AIDS education. An example of a successful school program is included.
results.description: In part 1, entitled “The True story” Professor John Dwyer of the University of New South Wales discusses the causes and effects of AIDS with a group of Year 10 to Year 12 students. results.title: Two sides of the river
results.creator_credit: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The port of Echuca was once Australia’s largest inland port along the Murray River. This program looks briefly at life on the river in the early days and at the tourist attraction that the river and its boats have become.

results.title: Helping people help themselves
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: This program explains the method of operation of the Family Conciliation Centre, which is a pilot project set up as an alternative to the overworked Family Law Court in the solving of family disputes.

results.title: Quintet
results.brief_description: Members of the Victorian Wind Quintet, working in the Music Teachers Project at Bendigo, demostrate the flute, clarinet, oboe, french horn and bassoon. Introduced by Trevor Lunn.

results.title: Assessment for better learning
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Jim Mann and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program discusses the theory that assessment methods that focus on individual students are effective in promoting student learning and provide parents, teachers, and students with better quality information about learning.
